body: I did not understand what you mean when you say: (because the air can be warmer than the MRT), you would get values that are above the saturation line. the Operative temperature (**to**) is given by [this equation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operative_temperature) so if the air temperature (or the mrt) increases, also the **to** increases and in a (**to**, x) chart, it occurs a shift to the right..
